FuncDef:
The ospf mpls-te peer command configures an OSPF passive neighbor on an interface to advertise passive-link information to the VRP for computation.
The undo ospf mpls-te peer command cancels the configuration.
By default, OSPF passive neighbor is not configured.
CLIs: ospf mpls-te peer peer-id <peer-id> remote-router-id <router-id> remote-ip <remote-if-address>
ospf mpls-te peer peer-id <peer-id> process <process-id> area { <area-id> | <area-id> }
undo ospf mpls-te peer peer-id <peer-id> remote-router-id <router-id> remote-ip <remote-if-address>
undo ospf mpls-te peer peer-id <peer-id> process <process-id> area { <area-id> | <area-id> }
undo ospf mpls-te peer peer-id <peer-id> cost [ <cost-value> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of the passive peer.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

Specifies the router ID of an OSPF passive neighbor.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the interface address of an OSPF passive neighbor.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the process ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295. By default, it is 1.

Specifies the area ID.
The value can be a decimal integer or an IP address. When the value is an integer, the value ranges from 0 to 4294967295.

Specifies the cost of the passive-link.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.
If metric-value is not specified, the default value 1 is used.

Examples: [~HUAWEI-GigabitEthernet1/0/0] ospf mpls-te peer peer-id 4 remote-router-id 4.4.4.4 remote-ip 1.1.1.1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
You can run the ospf mpls-te peer command to configure an OSPF passive neighbor on an interface to advertise passive-link information to the VRP for link verification and computation.
Prerequisites
An OSPF passive neighbor on an interface does not require any prerequisites, but to originate the passive-link, OSPF TE must have been enabled using the mpls-te enable command in the area view and the OSPF neighbor has reached the Full state.
Precautions
This configuration does not take effect if OSPF has been enabled on the interface using the ospf enable or network (OSPF) command.
